answers.answer: Best thing to do would be to talk to a doctor. Most likely there would be a lot of risks to both yourself and the baby if you chose to get pregnant again.

question: I'm 41 next week, having married last year we are talking about having a baby.  Having both have been married before we have two teenagers between us but would like to have a baby together.  I will be 41 next week, I'm overweight, have diabetes (although its not a severe case) plus a small hernia, but I am desperate to be a mother again.  Currently using an IUD and want to get it removed, but am worried about the risks to a baby and myself.  Can anyone help?
title: 40 Plus
